University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa: The University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa[a] (University of Hawaii–Mānoa, UH Mānoa, Hawaiʻi, or simply UH) is a public land-grant research university in Mānoa, a neighborhood of Honolulu, Hawaii.[9][10] It is the flagship campus of the University of Hawaiʻi system and houses the main offices of the system.[11] Most of the campus occupies the eastern half of the mouth of Mānoa Valley, with the John A. Burns School of Medicine located adjacent to the Kakaʻako Waterfront Park.
